Title:
Perenniporia subrhizomorpha sp. nov. (Polyporales,
Basidiomycota) from North China
Keywords:
macrofungi, taxonomy, wood-inhabiting fungi, one new
taxon
Abstract:
Perenniporia subrhizomorpha is introduced as a new species
from North China on the basis of morphological and molecular
examination. Phylogenetically, based on ITS and nLSU regions,
Perenniporia subrhizomorpha nested within the Perenniporia clade as a
distinct lineage. Perenniporia subrhizomorpha is characterized by having
an annual habit, resupinate and papery basidiomes, a dimitic hyphal
system with crystallized generative hyphae in context, ellipsoid,
truncated, dextrinoid basidiospores (5.76.5 × 4.35.5 μm), and the
absence of cystidia and cystidioles. The morphologically similar species
and phylogenetically closely-related species to the new species are
discussed.
